lexUnit.name: sprinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: scatter or pour (small drops or particles) over an object or surface.

sentence.text: On top of the thallium he sprinkled salt , a very little pepper and a coating of tarragon leaves .
Massage some vegetable oil over your flabby bits , then sprinkle some sea salt onto a flannel or natural sponge , and rub gently .
â€¢ Fruit that 's sharp can be sweetened up with artificial sweetener or sprinkle cinnamon on grapefruit instead of sugar .
Pour some over each serving , and sprinkle a teaspoon of brown sugar over each .
Kersey sprinkled sugar on his apple pie .
Sprinkle sharp sand along the slit -- enough to fill in the bottom 4-5 inches ( 10-12cm ) or so .
He sprinkled it freely in the gate opening and beyond in the passage , then turned to me .
So I sprinkled this stuff inside every pair of knickers in the drawer and then folded them all up again carefully . "

She chuckled , then might pick up the animal by the scruff ( if it were a cavey , or a bird ) , and dash it to death on the ground and spill the guts to read them for herself , then sprinkle blood inside the circle and on her cheeks and brow .
He then circled the poteau mitan , sprinkling rum into the dust .
Jamie snaps open the capsule and sprinkles its contents into the palm of his hand .
A man was sprinkling petrol on a heap of sprouts to help them burn .
` When she thought the room empty the whore pulled out a phial beneath her robes and sprinkled the contents on a loaf of bread .
Add to tomato juice for a piquant alternative to Worcestershire sauce or sprinkle it on corn on the cob before baking or barbecuing .
He sprinkled some snuff on the back of his hand and sniffed it .
The magicians told Vortigern he must find a boy with no father , sacrifice the child and sprinkle his blood on the fort 's foundations .
` I 'll sprinkle star-dust on your head . "
Sprinkle the gelatine onto the boiling water in a small bowl and stir well -- then leave for a minute or so to dissolve .
On the one hand , we eat all those pre-packed and refined foods and , on the other , we sprinkle bran over everything from soup to yoghourt .
Sprinkle the cheese over the beans .
Sprinkle the chives over the omelet , allow to just set , then fold over and slide out onto a plate .
He sprinkled water over the towel and then went into a paroxysm of agony , nursing the injured arm against his chest and holding out his other hand for money .
I sprinkled water in front of the altar , and put some flowers on it , violets and dogwood .
You sprinkle chocolate on top of the milk when it 's in the cups .
Sprinkle the thyme , lemon juice and seasoning over the skin and put the garlic cloves and bay leaves into the cavity .
In those days , an animal was offered in sacrifice to God , and its blood was sprinkled over the people as a sign of the one blood of life shared between God and his people .
A small quantity of oil is sprinkled on a clean rag and rubbed well into the surface to be polished .
The following morning , under the guidance of Margo , Nigel was sprinkled onto the compost heap and we said our final goodbyes .
Sprinkle the crumble mixture over the rhubarb and gently smooth the top .
The process of extracting the gold is a still more emotive issue , since the preferred method involves sprinkling a solution of cyanide ( which bonds with metals ) on to the ground-up ore .
The blood sprinkled on the people and on the altar unites the two parties to the agreement .
The bedroom of the hotel on Brussels ' rue Royale stank of vinegar which Jane Sharpe 's maid had sprinkled onto a red-hot shovel to fumigate the room .
Chop the hazelnuts and sprinkle evenly over the top .
You kept this powder in a little linen bag and you sprinkled a bit now and then in their bait . "
3 Meanwhile , place the crumbled bread in a small bowl , sprinkle over the milk and leave for 10-15 minutes .
